Name: Standing Statuette of Hapi
Description: This statuette depicts Hapi, the god of the Nile. He is portrayed as a man with full breasts, which are symbolic of the nurturing aspects of the river with its frequent flooding and silt that fertilized the fields of Egypt. Hapi wears the papyrus and lotus plants as a headdress. He wears a false beard on his chin and his left arm is broken but is raised as if it had been holding something.
